thread.title: Partners for Peace ‘Annual Be a Light Gift Card Drive’ returns for holiday season
thread.title_full: Partners for Peace ‘Annual Be a Light Gift Card Drive’ returns for holiday season

author: @WABI_TV5
title: Partners for Peace ‘Annual Be a Light Gift Card Drive’ returns for holiday season
text: Partners for Peace ‘Annual Be a Light Gift Card Drive’ returns for holiday season BANGOR, Maine (WABI) - Domestic violence awareness month is over but support for survivors is year-round. That’s why [Partners for Peace](https://www.partnersforpeaceme.org/) has launched their ‘Annual Be a Light Gift Card Drive’ for the third year. While they host many holiday drives, this residential program will provide survivors with funds to help survivors enjoy shopping for their families this holiday season. They’re collecting $5,000 in Visa, Walmart, and Hannaford gift cards. “We heard from survivors that it’s most helpful for them to be able to do their own Christmas and holiday shopping,” said Casey Faulkingham, director of development and engagement at Partners for Peace. “It’s also a lot more empowering.” They’re collecting these donations through Dec. 1, but are always welcoming donations for survivors. Gift cards can be mailed to PO Box 653, Bangor, ME 04402-0653 Re: Be A Light. Alternatively, you can mail a check or donate [online](https://linkprotect.cudasvc.com/url?a=https%3a%2f%2fl5kvh8cab.cc.rs6.net%2ftn.jsp%3ff%3d001CYY0vL28PU7OY3I1XHPXgXVxBGhlmRGWatxp69i-BpDqHLB3bYzHKwIJqkCFP0Y6Bfb1WVc6uNO64s6M01_8ZJcf6eoKGEzaNmBA7fdGfe564F4rNkFi3DovjJ8zNwCxwgaux_I0ZNx0dIc6EcGjS_2Ce0tiMqIhRsqKOoW60UGZHM0_kQt937SaH6f5x8Tk-bTF3Ce9_fXJHObCXu2dLJq2p9-TTB6md5pDy2U_l5C73EyXlAian1v3AUjHrZrp3-o6_Fgxs6grl-ek2KfrgsVnN41We-0ZLttjJbFoWCOOn-aIq3kloUI0t9QR7CIGaHNYNG_C1Kz0JX5DNa0GwuAgMogN6JU4p-secU7y1_-rS01yn7pxGeBDNpWyPYkAGqeRNg_e3RyGLP4Q-_GT9xfFXulUsIE3eT3wx8AjFMOtf-hwaDL2KklcxcwSmhD6nZO59CeX70GUHAC7e5z7HTA2dzLFkPcRtE48aVDNzHvjtH2gQYIYoCsBOYV35Ez9OKdvEZOPpkpa6SyOXl4SuTPFT94Xvlck86fD8VxvQzIgGKooqrSMdyKI8xPcHx8XX0B3SEoHKmeYYtLBCKgVb5d2ti0IZt6VgqoB8fi8EqB6HEDEygMafoxEsaeruxHV9jEUn-p119wAtwtqfkGIRjwnIhdIwpvOI0lMHfn8bdZknrv1IdyWuflus9Hgh7-U5amqEkXfyobzFKzZZWANc0mCDl4IB6UxceJGtYpb4BgAA-sF9Ru6mpWz5dpskFFDeg36tuqml2lSs6XCodkrjR_Wu3nFLDmK%26c%3dqAnbVdFzEh0nmtwioxJ3Dasz109kWcxP1knPbhh5Nrhh_cbOfMH3uA%3d%3d%26ch%3dWPyHMAzMTxF0-Zbnvyu7jWsz2IqDmbHh73FfTUjfa-l4begCvqTLaA%3d%3d&c=E,1,mbqIVwggsMRXJE4nHRSXn7TlKciSSuaUhDWewWrpLf5aBtq1T0a9U5Ii8A8C-Mqpis-fNr1rYoHJg1C4194jef9HP51sNUzMOpFB4EVUQB93iRnJHdaz&typo=1) and note that it’s for the Be A Light Program.
